responses: My name is chatbot, nice to meet you!
Machine learning is an area of artificial intelligence that involves the research and development of techniques that allow systems to learn automatically from data to solve specific problems.
Applications of Machine Learning include: Web Search Engine, Photo tagging Applications, Spam Detector, Database Mining for growth of automation, face recognition...

The programming language is a subset of the computer language, designed and standardized to transmit instructions to machines with processors, in particular computers. Programming language is used to program computers, create machine programs that control the computer or describe algorithms for others to read and understand.

Python is a high-level programming language for general-purpose programming purposes, created by Guido van Rossum and first launched in 1991. Python is designed with strong advantages of being easy to read, easy to learn and remember. . Python is a language with a very bright form, clear structure, convenient for beginners to programming.
In computer science, artificial intelligence or AI, sometimes called artificial intelligence, is the intelligence expressed by machines, in contrast to the natural intelligence shown by humans.
Application software is a type of program capable of making a computer directly perform a task that a user wants to perform.
Computer science is the study of the theoretical foundations of information and computing and their implementation and application in computer systems.
JavaScript, according to the current version, is an interpreted programming language developed from prototype concepts. This language is widely used for websites as well as server side.
Supervised learning is a technique of machine learning to build a function from the training data. Training data consists of pairs of desired input and output objects.

Unsupervised learning is a method of machine learning aimed at finding a model that fits the observations. It differs from supervised learning in that the corresponding correct output for each input is unknown.
